title: Napier City Rovers FC
text:
Napier City Rovers is a <a href="Association%20football">football</a> team based in <a href="Napier%2C%20New%20Zealand">Napier</a>, New Zealand, competing in the <a href="Central%20Premier%20League">Central Premier League</a>.
Club history.
The team was founded in 1973 via a merger of Napier Rovers and Napier City.
Napier City Rovers have won New Zealand's premier knockout football competition (the <a href="Chatham%20Cup">Chatham Cup</a>) five times, in 1985, 1993, 2000, 2002, and 2019 won the old <a href="New%20Zealand%20National%20Soccer%20League">New Zealand National Soccer League</a> in 1989, 1993, 1998, and 2000. They represented New Zealand at the <a href="Oceania%20Club%20Championship%202000-01">Oceania Club Championship in 2001</a>, finishing third.
The <a href="Hawke%27s%20Bay">Hawke's Bay</a> region, of which Napier is a part, were represented by Napier City Soccer in the first year of New Zealand's new <a href="New%20Zealand%20Football%20Championship">Football Championship</a> in the summer of 2004, the only region that was not represented by an amalgamated franchise. That changed the following year with the change of name also to <a href="Hawke%27s%20Bay%20United">Hawke's Bay United</a>. As with all teams making up the new franchises, they continue to compete in local winter football leagues, and also in the Chatham Cup.
